title: Drawing, "A Classical Temple", ca. 1780
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and watercolor, over black chalk on paper
inscribed: Inscribed in black chalk at lower right: Con Sotterraneo; indication of scale in pen and black ink at lower center.
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Elevation and plan, one above the other, of a Classical temple.  The building is located on a platform and reached via steps (nine in total).  A narrow, steep flight of stairs leads to the door. There are two statues located at the foot of the stairs.  Portico with two rows of four Ionic columns and a triangular pediment.  Above, a high drum and a dome. The plan portion of the drawing shows the temple on a large platform.
